summary: The 'International Competition for American Jobs Act' amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify provisions related to the taxation of international entities. Key changes include extending the look-thru rule, altering deductions for foreign-derived intangible income, modifying base erosion minimum tax, adjusting foreign tax credit limitation baskets, restoring limitations on stock ownership attribution, allowing carryover of net CFC tested losses, redetermining foreign taxes, repealing the foreign tax credit haircut on global intangible low-taxed income, applying the foreign-source dividend deduction, eliminating certain income inclusions, and providing special rules for transfers of intangible property and regarding from services performed in the Virgin Islands. The core goal is to improve the competitiveness of American businesses in relation to international taxation rules.
